channel.title: FreeBSD | Deakin IOT & Software Engineering Lab

item.title: Implementing an Experience-Driven L4S Internet Service Architecture in FreeBSD
item.description:
This project, supported by the APNIC Foundation, explores how Low Latency, Low Loss, and Scalable Throughput (L4S) network technologies can be implemented within the FreeBSD networking stack.

The goal is to demonstrate how intelligent queue management and latency-aware design can support more responsive internet services, particularly for applications such as:

  • Cloud gaming
  • Real-time video conferencing
  • Industrial IoT communications

This work contributes to the ongoing efforts to modernize network infrastructure using standards defined by the IETF (RFC 9330), while enhancing the user Quality of Experience (QoE) across varying network conditions.

For more information, visit the official project page:
